title: Yéil ḵa G̱uwakaan / Raven and Deer
author: Ḵeixwnéi / Nora Marks Dauenhauer
transcriber: Dzéiwsh / James A. Crippen, X̱ʼunei / Lance Twitchell, Ḵaagwáaskʼ / Ishmael Hope

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Ax̱ dachx̱ánkʼ áwé wa.é.
sentences.sentence_english: You are my little grandchild.

lines.line_english: You are my little grandchild.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Ách áwé tlél wáa sá utí ax̱ x̱ʼéidáx̱ kayshaxeedí.
sentences.sentence_english: Thatʼs why itʼs okay for you to write what I say.

lines.line_tlingit: Ách áwé tlél wáa sá utí ax̱ x̱ʼéidáx̱ kayshaxeedí.
lines.line_english: Thatʼs why itʼs okay for you to write what I say.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tlél ḵwa tlax̱ kʼát x̱washagóok.
sentences.sentence_english: But Iʼm not very good at it.

lines.line_english: But Iʼm not very good at it.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Chʼas át áwé ux̱sa.aax̱jín áwé yoo x̱ʼatánk, wé tlaagóo.
sentences.sentence_english: I used to only listen to the talk, the stories.

lines.line_tlingit: Chʼas át áwé ux̱sa.aax̱jín áwé yoo x̱ʼatánk,
lines.line_english: I used to only listen to the talk,
the stories.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Chʼas át x̱wasa.aax̱í áwé x̱wsikóo.
sentences.sentence_english: I only know what I listened to then.

lines.line_english: I only know what I listened to then.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Hél ḵoon koox̱laneek.
sentences.sentence_english: I donʼt tell stories to people.

lines.line_english: I donʼt tell stories to people.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle first time áyá kakḵwalaneek.
sentences.sentence_english: Iʼm going to tell this for the first time.

lines.line_english: Iʼm going to tell this for the first time.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Chʼu shóogu áwé, Yéil ḵa G̱uwakaan.
sentences.sentence_english: Itʼs the first one, Raven and Deer.

lines.line_tlingit: Chʼu shóogu áwé, Yéil ḵa G̱uwakaan.
lines.line_english: Itʼs the first one, Raven and Deer.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Chʼa g̱oot yéide kadulneek; aadé x̱wsikoowu yé yáx̱ kakḵwalaneek.
sentences.sentence_english: People tell it a little differently; I will tell it the way I know it.

lines.line_english: People tell it a little differently;
I will tell it
the way I know it.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Tle chʼa g̱oot yéide chʼa yéi gugéinkʼ g̱oot yéide yatee ax̱ aayí.
sentences.sentence_english: Only a different way, mine is just a little bit different.

lines.line_english: Only a different way,

lines.line_tlingit: chʼa yéi gugéinkʼ g̱oot yéide yatee ax̱ aayí.
lines.line_english: mine is just a little bit different.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Hél wáa sá utí yá ax̱ shukát sh kawdlineegí ḵu.oo yá G̱uwakaan ḵa Yéil.
sentences.sentence_english: The storytellers ahead of me told it well, this Deer and Raven.

lines.line_tlingit: Hél wáa sá utí yá ax̱ shukát
lines.line_english: The storytellers ahead of me
told it well,
this Deer and Raven.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Dag̱aakʼéi ḵúnáx̱. Chʼa g̱oot yéide ḵwa s aklaneek.
sentences.sentence_english: They are each very good. But they tell it differently.

lines.line_english: They are each very good.

lines.line_tlingit: Chʼa g̱oot yéide ḵwa s aklaneek.
lines.line_english: But they tell it differently.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Hél wáa sá utí chʼa ayáx̱ duwa.áx̱ch.
sentences.sentence_english: Itʼs okay as long as it sounds right.

lines.line_tlingit: Hél wáa sá utí chʼa ayáx̱ duwa.áx̱ch.
lines.line_english: Itʼs okay as long as it sounds right.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yéi áyá.
sentences.sentence_english: Thatʼs the way.

lines.line_english: Thatʼs the way.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Ha kakḵwalaneek áwé dei.
sentences.sentence_english: And now I will tell it.

lines.line_english: And now I will tell it.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Gu.aal kwshégé tlél ux̱ kéi utéeg̱ei.
sentences.sentence_english: Hopefully it wonʼt be mistaken.

lines.line_tlingit: Gu.aal kwshégé tlél ux̱ kéi utéeg̱ei.
lines.line_english: Hopefully it wonʼt be mistaken.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Neechx̱ áwé yaa nagút Yéil.
sentences.sentence_english: Along the beach he walked, Raven.

lines.line_english: Along the beach he walked, Raven.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Neechx̱ yaa nagúdi teen áwé kadulnik nuch.
sentences.sentence_english: People always tell it with him walking along the beach.

lines.line_tlingit: Neechx̱ yaa nagúdi teen áwé kadulnik nuch.
lines.line_english: People always tell it with him walking along the beach.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Ax̱ gukáaxʼ yéi x̱at gusagéinkʼi, áwé neechx̱ áwé yaa nagút Yéil.
sentences.sentence_english: It was clear when I was small, that he was walking along the beach, Raven.

lines.line_english: It was clear when I was small,

lines.line_tlingit: áwé neechx̱ áwé yaa nagút Yéil.
lines.line_english: that he was walking along the beach, Raven.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áwé a yáa uwagút wé G̱uwakaan.
sentences.sentence_english: Then he came upon that Deer.

lines.line_tlingit: Áwé a yáa uwagút wé G̱uwakaan.
lines.line_english: Then he came upon that Deer.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: G̱uwakaan áwé a yáa uwagút.
sentences.sentence_english: It was Deer that he came upon.

lines.line_english: It was Deer that he came upon.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áwé taay áwé tle yáax̱ dixwásʼ.
sentences.sentence_english: Fat was just hanging down here.

lines.line_tlingit: Áwé taay áwé tle yáax̱ dixwásʼ.
lines.line_english: Fat was just hanging down here.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: «Kʼe ax̱ yaḵáawu» tle yoo ash yawsiḵaa wé Yéil «i lug̱eitlʼí tle wéix̱ dixwásʼ.» So he took them and gulped them right away.
sentences.sentence_english: “Hey my buddy” he said to him, that Raven did, “your snot is just hanging down there.” So he took them and gulped them right away.

lines.line_tlingit: «Kʼe ax̱ yaḵáawu» tle yoo ash yawsiḵaa wé Yéil
lines.line_english: “Hey my buddy” he said to him, that Raven did,
“your snot is just hanging down there.”

lines.line_tlingit: So he took them and gulped them right away.
lines.line_english: So he took them and gulped them right away.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Ḵúnáx̱ tléḵwgun Yéil.
sentences.sentence_english: He was really greedy, Raven.

lines.line_english: He was really greedy, Raven.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Chʼa wé iyatéen wé grocery áa duhoon yé.
sentences.sentence_english: You can see that where groceries are sold.

lines.line_tlingit: Chʼa wé iyatéen wé grocery áa duhoon yé.
lines.line_english: You can see that where groceries are sold.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Ldakát át has kanalyíchch chʼa atx̱ág̱aa.
sentences.sentence_english: Theyʼre all flying around for food.

lines.line_tlingit: Ldakát át has kanalyíchch chʼa atx̱ág̱aa.
lines.line_english: Theyʼre all flying around for food.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áwé aawanóotʼ wé a lug̱eitlʼí, taay ḵu.aa áwé.
sentences.sentence_english: He swallowed its snot, but it was actually fat.

lines.line_english: He swallowed its snot,
but it was actually fat.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áwé tle g̱unéi uwagút.
sentences.sentence_english: Then he started to walk again.

lines.line_english: Then he started to walk again.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áwé yéi toowdisháat «Kʼe ḵúnáx̱ áyú yá taay yú g̱uwakaan.
sentences.sentence_english: Then he thought, “That deer really has some fat.

lines.line_english: Then he thought,

lines.line_tlingit: «Kʼe ḵúnáx̱ áyú yá taay yú g̱uwakaan.
lines.line_english: “That deer really has some fat.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Kʼe kanḵaladoodlí sʼé.» Áwé akawlidootl.
sentences.sentence_english: Let me entice him first.” So he enticed him.

lines.line_english: Let me entice him first.”
So he enticed him.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yá aas yá x̱ʼaak kaanáx̱ yan uwashóo, aas.
sentences.sentence_english: This tree was lying across this ravine, a tree.

lines.line_english: This tree

lines.line_tlingit: yá x̱ʼaak kaanáx̱ yan uwashóo, aas.
lines.line_english: was lying across this ravine, a tree.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: «Kʼe a kaanáx̱ aadéi nax̱too.aadí diyáanax̱.á. » He wanted to go across.
sentences.sentence_english: “Letʼs go across the tree to the other side.” He wanted to go across.

lines.line_english: “Letʼs go across the tree to the other side.”
He wanted to go across.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áwé aadéi tuwatee wé diyáa.
sentences.sentence_english: He wanted to get on the other side.

lines.line_english: He wanted to get on the other side.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Aadé ashung̱agoodít áwé asayahéi.
sentences.sentence_english: He wanted to lead him there.

lines.line_english: He wanted to lead him there.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Awsikóo ḵwa naaḵw áwé, wé aas.
sentences.sentence_english: But he knew it was rotten wood, that tree.

lines.line_english: But he knew it was rotten wood,
that tree.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: ‹Naaḵw› ḵu.aa áwé yú át áwé yéi duséix̱. Chʼáagu aasí, wudináḵw.
sentences.sentence_english: They usually call it ʼrotten woodʼ. An old tree, itʼs punky.

lines.line_tlingit: ‹Naaḵw› ḵu.aa áwé yú át áwé yéi duséix̱.
lines.line_english: They usually call it ʼrotten woodʼ.
An old tree,
itʼs punky.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: A kaanáx̱ áwé asayahéi.
sentences.sentence_english: He wants him to go over it.

lines.line_english: He wants him to go over it.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: «Hél wáa sá ikg̱wanéi, ax̱ yaḵáawu» yú adaayaḵá.
sentences.sentence_english: “Nothing will happen to you, my friend” heʼs saying.

lines.line_tlingit: «Hél wáa sá ikg̱wanéi, ax̱ yaḵáawu» yú adaayaḵá.
lines.line_english: “Nothing will happen to you, my friend” heʼs saying.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Heʼs calling him ‹ax̱ yaḵáawu›. Áwé «Kʼe i shukát anáx̱ yánde kḵwagóot.» Áwé tle a kaanáx̱ yaa nagút.
sentences.sentence_english: Heʼs calling him ʼmy friendʼ. So, “I will cross over before you.” So then heʼs walking over it.

lines.line_english: Heʼs calling him ʼmy friendʼ.
So,
“I will cross over before you.”
So then
heʼs walking over it.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Wé x̱ʼaak ḵu.aa áwé naaléi yú diyéede.
sentences.sentence_english: That crevice, though, itʼs a long way down there.

lines.line_english: That crevice, though,
itʼs a long way down there.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: A kaanáx̱ áwé át tán wé naaḵw.
sentences.sentence_english: Itʼs lying over it, that rotten wood.

lines.line_english: Itʼs lying over it,
that rotten wood.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áwé áa ashukoojeisʼ «Yú áwé a káanáx̱ yánde kg̱eegóot, ax̱ yaḵáawu. » «Úsh x̱at latín kútlʼ!» tle yéi yanaḵéich.
sentences.sentence_english: Heʼs instructing him there “Thatʼs how youʼll cross over, my friend.” “Just watch me, you fart!” he said then.

lines.line_english: Heʼs instructing him there

lines.line_tlingit: «Yú áwé a káanáx̱ yánde kg̱eegóot, ax̱ yaḵáawu. »
lines.line_english: “Thatʼs how youʼll cross over, my friend.”

lines.line_tlingit: «Úsh x̱at latín kútlʼ!» tle yéi yanaḵéich.
lines.line_english: “Just watch me, you fart!” he said then.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: «Úsh x̱at latín kútlʼ! Úsh x̱at latín kútlʼ!» Tle yá a káanáx̱ yánde yaa nagút áwé tle a shuká kadaḵéen.
sentences.sentence_english: “Just watch me, you fart! Just watch me, you fart!” When heʼs walking over it, ahead of him, heʼs kind of flying.

lines.line_tlingit: «Úsh x̱at latín kútlʼ! Úsh x̱at latín kútlʼ!»
lines.line_english: “Just watch me, you fart! Just watch me, you fart!”

lines.line_tlingit: Tle yá a káanáx̱ yánde yaa nagút áwé tle a shuká kadaḵéen.
lines.line_english: When heʼs walking over it, ahead of him, heʼs kind of flying.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: A shuká áx̱ yaa nagúdi tle yaa ndaḵín.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Hél tlax̱ kʼát du koodáali a káa yéi wutee wé naaḵw ká.
sentences.sentence_english: His full weight was not really on that rotten wood.

sentences.sentence_english: Heʼs still flying ahead of him across that tree. When heʼs done going across, he tells his friend “Try it, my buddy.

sentences.sentence_english: When it broke with him he fell down to the bottom of that ravine.
